meanings.definition: To move with a splashing or swishing sound.
meanings.sent1: The kids were swashing in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The river was swashing against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to be swashing around happily in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The wind was swashing through the trees, making them sway gently.
meanings.sent5: I could hear the waves swashing against the shore as I walked along the beach.

meanings.sent1: He was swashing around the party, trying to impress everyone.
meanings.sent2: The pirate captain swashed into the room, demanding attention.
meanings.sent3: The peacock swashed proudly around the garden, showing off its feathers.
meanings.sent4: The politician swashed through the crowd, making grand promises.
meanings.sent5: The superhero swashed into the scene, ready to save the day.

meanings.definition: The sound of water splashing or swishing.
meanings.sent1: The swashing of the waves against the boat was calming.
meanings.sent2: The swashing of the fountain added a peaceful ambiance to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The swashing of the waterfall could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent4: The swashing of the stream echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The swashing of the rain on the roof was a lullaby to her ears.
